result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Steven Milligan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Meet with DOC representative within 48 hours.

miscConds.notes: Fine and court costs totaling $565.60.    Cash bond applied.  If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Huber release granted, hours and conditions to be set by Sheriff's Dept. where jail sentence will be served.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.
Defendant is to undergo any counseling as recommended by Agent.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety and no consumption of illegal drugs.    Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

PH on 16CF28, Initial on 16CT16, tracking citations 16TR234 and 16TR235.
Defendant Derek Steven Milligan in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jarred Jeffress sword and questioned by DA Bourg.  Exhibit #1 marked; officer's report.  Directed to serve TRO upon Derek Milligan on 01-15-2016; identifies defendant.  TRO was requested by Krista Defoe; contacted Ms. Defoe to investigate incident.  Exhibit #1 reviewed by Atty Rafferty; Court breaks to allow Atty Rafferty time to review exhibit.  Court receives the exhibit with no objection.  Cross by Atty Rafferty.  Did rely on victim's statement when developing report.  No re-direct by DA Bourg.  No further witnesses for the State.  No witnesses for the defense.
Argument by DA Bourg; asks for bind over.  Argument by Atty Rafferty; has to be intent with this act; no specifics given to the Court.  
Court; satisfied evidence shown and inferences can draw, finds probable cause felony committed and this defendant was involved; defendant bound over.
16CT16, bail hearing; Atty Rafferty appears specially for this case.  Defendant has rec'd copy of complaint from DA Bourg, charges read.  Arraignment scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:05 am.
